column4: Macbook Pro 7,1: I insert 10.04 install cd and it throws me to a busybox screen and says "not init found. Try passing init= bootarg."
Any suggestions?
i have that laptop
I dont think i ever ran 10.04 on it, only releases after that, and are you booting in BIOS or EFI mode?
it would be sweet if I could get ubuntu on it.
I have Ubuntu 11.10 on mine
How do I change the mode?
are you planning to dual boot OSX or single install Ubuntu?
single install
I dont think 10.04 will work in EFI mode out of the box
boot the laptop and hold down ALT and it should give you a menu. I think you can choose there whether to boot in EFI or BIOS mode
newer versions will?
yes, 11.10 works
I have 11.10 in EFI mode which is a problem because nVidia binary driver doesn't work in EFI mode â˜¹
when I hold down option key, it just shows me the boot from cd choice.
computer is currently wiped.
does it show two cdroms or one on screen when you hold down alt?
one.
hmm
not sure, sorry, i used 11.10 and it pretty much works okay
some glitches
I had it on my older macbook.
guess I will have to try the dual boot.
just don't like the newer versions.
